markdown: Annual Meeting of Members of Helen Keller International, Incorporated held in the Polly Thomson Room of the American Foundation for the Blind, 15 West 16th Street, New York, NY on Wednesday, November 12, 1980. The meeting was called to order at 2:00 PM by the Chairman of the Board, Mr. Jansen Noyes, Jr. Mrs. Barbara Shiflet, Assistant Secretary, presented an affidavit of mailing notice of the meeting and an alphabetical list of Members. On motion duly made and seconded, the same was then filed. The Chairman called for proxies which were submitted by the Assistant Secretary, who reported that out of a total of 10 members, six were present and three by proxy, making nine in all and thus constituting a quorum. On motion duly made and seconded, the minutes of the previous annual meeting of Members held on November 14, 1979 - mailed in advance - were approved unanimously. In presenting the slate of Trustees and Trustees Emeriti, the Chairman reported the willingness of Mr. Robert Mercer of the Canadian Institute for the Blind and Professor Daniel Sisler of Cornell University to become members of the Board of Trustees. On motion duly made and seconded the following slate of Trustees and Trustees Emeriti was unanimously elected: TRUSTEES Mitchell Brock John S. Crowley William J. Darby, M.D. Richard E. Hoover, M.D. Carl Kupfer, M.D. Robert Mercer Jansen Noyes, Jr. Stephen L. Porter Dr. Peter J. Salmon TRUSTEES (cont'd) Dr. Daniel C. Sisler Wesley D. Sprague Nathan A. Turkheimer TRUSTEES EMERITI Ramon Castroviejo, M.D. Alexander M. Laughlin Frank K. Sanders, Jr. ~~Lowell Thomas~~ William Ziegler, III Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/gfhv0228

The meeting was called to order at 2:00 PM by the Chairman of the Board, Mr. Jansen Noyes, Jr. Mrs. Barbara Shiflet, Assistant Secretary, presented an affidavit of mailing notice of the meeting and an alphabetical list of Members. On motion duly made and seconded, the same was then filed.

The Chairman called for proxies which were submitted by the Assistant Secretary, who reported that out of a total of 10 members, six were present and three by proxy, making nine in all and thus constituting a quorum.
On motion duly made and seconded, the minutes of the previous annual meeting of Members held on November 14, 1979 - mailed in advance - were approved unanimously.

In presenting the slate of Trustees and Trustees Emeriti, the Chairman reported the willingness of Mr. Robert Mercer of the Canadian Institute for the Blind and Professor Daniel Sisler of Cornell University to become members of the Board of Trustees. On motion duly made and seconded the following slate of Trustees and Trustees Emeriti was unanimously elected:

TRUSTEES EMERITI Ramon Castroviejo, M.D. Alexander M. Laughlin Frank K. Sanders, Jr. ~~Lowell Thomas~~ William Ziegler, III
